intro: Diplotaxis ilorcitana, commonly known as the Namib Desert cress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in extreme desert conditions. It has a low-growing habit with succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Diplotaxis ilorcitana plays a role in its ecosystem by providing food for local insects and serving as a pioneer species in disturbed soils.
